description:
See ifconfig attached below, there we can see that Address 192.168.22.33 already assigned to bridge br100.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sajuptpm

comments.content:
Do you see the following lines in your nova-network log?

Command: sudo nova-rootwrap kill -HUP 5554
Exit code: 99
Stdout: 'Unauthorized command: kill -HUP 5554\n'

I'm seeing the same issue on stable-essex from time to time.  Looks like it may be related to https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1010275.   The attached log appears to cut off the lines I mentioned above which are the giveaway that this is a rootwrap-related issue.  This may be as simple as backporting the fix for bug 1010275 to stable-essex.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ryan-tidwell

comments.content:
The most likely cause of this:

  dnsmasq: failed to create listening socket for 192.168.22.33: Address already in use

is that there is an instance of dnsmasq running which is listening on all interfaces?

Could you do e.g.

  $> ps -ef | grep dnsmasq

?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content: We cannot solve the issue you reported without more information. Could you please provide the requested information ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: This bug lacks the necessary information to effectively reproduce and fix it, therefore it has been closed. Feel free to reopen the bug by providing the requested information and set the bug status back to ''New''.
